alert.note: Alert for Box Elder; Cache; Morgan; Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 10 at 3:29PM MST until January 10 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Weber County in northern Utah... Southeastern Cache County in northern Utah... East central Box Elder County in northern Utah... West central Morgan County in northern Utah... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 328 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Hyrum to 11 miles northwest of Hooper, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 15 between mile markers 344 and 363. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Brigham City, North Ogden, Perry, Willard, Marriott-Slaterville, Mantua, South Willard, Weber State University, West Haven, Pleasant View, Farr West, Harrisville, Plain City, Paradise, Huntsville, Mountain Green, Eden, Liberty, and Mantua Reservoir. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
